it.polimi.ingsw.network

Interface RemoteInterface

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.rmi.Remote
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    RMIClient, RMIServer

    public interface RemoteInterface
extends java.rmi.Remote
    This interface is implemented by RMIServer and RMIClient its methods handle the remote connection beetwen Lobby and Client(the latter will not implements the Broadcast)
    Author:
    Francesco Masciulli

    • Method Detail

      • acceptRemoteClient

        void acceptRemoteClient(int remotePort,
                        java.lang.String remoteIPAddress,
                        java.lang.String bindName)
                 throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        handle the connection between two remote hosts
        Parameters:
        remotePort - is the server Port, from the NetConfiguration Class
        remoteIPAddress - is the ip address of the host to which is trying the connection
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if couldn't connect properly

      • clientConnectionGuard

        void clientConnectionGuard()
                    throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        this method check the livability of a host with a continue lifeline
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if couldn't be called by remote

      • remoteSendMessage

        void remoteSendMessage(Event message)
                throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Implementation with RMI of the sendMessage()
        Parameters:
        message - is the mesagge that must be sent
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if couldn't be called by remote

      • remoteSetCurrEvent

        void remoteSetCurrEvent(RemoteInterface remoteImplementation)
                 throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        is called during the remoteSendMessage() from a RMIClient, wait for a latch
        Parameters:
        remoteImplementation - is the client remote implementation in which will be retrieved the message
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if client isn't reachable

      • remoteCleanCurrEvent

        void remoteCleanCurrEvent()
                   throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        clean the currMessage, is called by server when the client message is retrieved
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if couldn't be called by remote

      • remoteSendBroadcast

        void remoteSendBroadcast(Event message)
                  throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        This method send a message to each of the connected client
        Parameters:
        message - is the Event that must be sent
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if couldn't reach the server

      • remoteListenMessage

        Event remoteListenMessage()
                   throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        update a listened message
        Returns:
        the listened message, null if the currMessage isn't updated
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if couldn't be called by remote

      • getClientListNumber

        int getClientListNumber()
                 throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Getter method:
        Returns:
        the number of client connected to the server
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if couldn't get the resource properly
